title: Europe needs to listen to the unusual suspects - E3G
summary: Europe needs to act faster and more boldly to transition to a prosperous and fair net zero economy. This requires a different way of doing politics, reaching out to new voices and including citizens, consumers, and companies providing new solutions. Europe has four powerful pillars to support a clean transition: fast political decision-making, cheap renewable energy resources, technology and research leadership, and a strong single market and continental power grid.

title: Cosmetic 360: “The green transition is an innovation challenge” - Premium beauty
summary: The Cosmetic 360 show will focus on clean technology, with a focus on decarbonization, waste management, circular economy, biomaterials, and other technologies serving the green transition. The show will feature a new Innovation Center showcasing startups committed to new solutions, a Cleantech “totem” to help visitors spot new ecoresponsible solutions, and a transversal award for the Best Cleantech Innovation. The show will also include a Startup Station welcoming about 30 young companies developing clean innovations and a Greentech area offering an immersive experience involving a 3D screen technology for the development of sustainable ingredients.

title: Government of Canada announces $9.9 million to scale up B.C. technology businesses and improve productivity - Canada NewsWire
summary: The Government of Canada is providing $ 9.9 million to Innovate BC to establish and grow the Integrated Marketplace, a platform that connects B.C. technology companies with large-scale B.C. organizations to test and implement new sustainable innovations in real-world business environments.  The marketplace will support the development of innovative solutions that address business challenges and advance climate goals, helping B.C. companies to grow their markets at home and abroad. The first testbed projects are focused on developing digital tools to optimize the supply chain at the Port of Vancouver, electrifying support vehicles on the airfield at Vancouver International Airport (YVR), and reducing the use of diesel fuel at the Port of Prince Rupert.

title: Elemis partners with Morro to create upcycled single-use sachets for cosmetics - Premium beauty
summary: Elemis is collaborating with Morro to develop heat-sealable films made from plant-based waste materials to replace single-use plastics used in skincare samples. The project aims to find a sustainable solution for difficult-to-recycle sachets and reduce the environmental impact of packaging. Elemis is committed to making all of its packaging recyclable, reusable, or biodegradable by 2025.
green_innovation: TRUE, the innovation contributes to environmental sustainability by reducing the use of single-use plastics and utilizing waste materials.
business_innovation: TRUE, the innovation is a new product (bio-based film) that differs significantly from the company's previous products and has not yet been brought to market.

title: CICE Funds Innovation to Advance the Measuring, Monitoring, and Verification (MMV) of Carbon Management - Canada NewsWire
summary: The B.C. Centre for Innovation and Clean Energy (CICE) has announced $2.82 million in funding to four B.C.-based companies developing commercial pathways for innovative solutions that support the measurement, monitoring, and verification (MMV) of carbon emission reduction, removal, and avoidance. This investment will help advance the expansion of the global carbon credit market and spur further investment in emissions-reductions programs and technologies.
green_innovation: TRUE, the article describes innovations that contribute to environmental sustainability goals, such as decarbonization and reducing resource consumption by developing a circular economy.
business_innovation: TRUE, the article describes new or improved products or business processes that differ significantly from the firm's previous products or business processes.

green_process: TRUE, the article describes processes that minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability, such as quantifying and validating carbon dioxide removal via carbon mineralization and assessing the carbon sequestration capacity of land.
